page.title: 08FARMS IN WEASENHAM
page.content: The farm which occupies the central part of our "D"Block is MANOR FARM Weasenham which is part of the syndi- cate known as WEASENHAM FARMS.Winter wheat is the major crop with sugar beet,spring wheat, spring barley and vining peas grown also.One farm manager,3 farmworkers, 3 mechanics and 4 lorrydrivers are employed.There is a radio tower at the farm. To the south of the "D"Block is HIGH HOUSE FARM owned and farmed by Major Coke and his 2 sons. They employ 7 people: 3 tractor drivers, 2 woodmen,1 gamekeeper and 1 building man. The crops grown are winter wheat for both milling and seed, winter barley for malting, winter field beans for animal food, spring field beans for pet pigeon food, sugar beet and forage rape. A small flock of rare "Portland" sheep is kept.
